meanings.definition: The act of giving water to plants or crops.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy the watering of my garden every morning.
meanings.sent2: The farmer does the watering of his fields regularly.
meanings.sent3: The watering of the flowers seemed to make them dance happily.
meanings.sent4: Her care was like the watering of a parched land, bringing life to everything around her.
meanings.sent5: The watering of the plants was like a gentle shower, refreshing and nurturing.

meanings.definition: The act of producing saliva in the mouth.
meanings.sent1: After smelling the delicious food, my mouth started watering.
meanings.sent2: The thought of a juicy burger can lead to watering of the mouth.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food had my mouth watering in anticipation.
meanings.sent4: Her description of the dessert was so vivid, it set my mouth watering.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread had mouths watering throughout the bakery.

meanings.sent1: His watering at the sad movie touched everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent2: The baby's watering was a sign of her discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes had the audience watering with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her watering during the emotional speech showed her deep connection to the cause.
meanings.sent5: The play's ending had many in the audience watering with empathy for the characters.
